body_html: @paddyhoran we don't have the latest .whl file for windows set up yet. To compile it from source, we can use the steps in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/.jenkins/win-build.sh#L31-L78, change aws s3 cp to curl and ignore the CUDA-specific settings. We will also need Visual Studio 2017 installed before compiling PyTorch.

body: @paddyhoran we don't have the latest .whl file for windows set up yet. To compile it from source, we can use the steps in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/.jenkins/win-build.sh#L31-L78, change `aws s3 cp` to `curl` and ignore the CUDA-specific settings. We will also need Visual Studio 2017 installed before compiling PyTorch.
